Easyrider

"Mr. President, the status quo is not working for Americans," said (Michele) Bachmann. "The status quo certainly isn't working for the African-American community, with 16 percent unemployment, or the Hispanic community, with nearly 12 percent unemployment. It's even worse for the youth: For Hispanic youth right now, 26 percent unemployment; for African-American youth, 40 percent unemployment.
 
 "This president has failed the Hispanic community," said Bachmann. "He has failed the African-American community. He has failed us all when it comes to jobs. - CNSNews.com
 
 How's that 'Hope and Change' working out for the Blacks and Hispanics? And for the rest of America? No doubt most Blacks will vote for Obama again, though. 
 
 Discussion...
Shooterandproud

I am also a bit disappointed in him. What exactly has he done during his term as president? Did he audit the fed? No. Did he end any unjust foreign wars? No. Did he end the costly and ineffective drug prohibition? No. These three things could've extraordinarily improved the quality of life of people both here and abroad and helped balance our budget. They could've finally given back to the people some of the liberties they deserve. And yet Obama did none of the above during his time in office.

"Mr. President, the status quo is not working for Americans," said (Michele) Bachmann. It's even worse for the youth: For Hispanic youth right now, 26 percent unemployment; for African-American youth, 40 percent unemployment.

 It is not the Governments Duty to Create Jobs. The GOP claimed that the Bush Tax cuts and increased corporate Welfare would create and environment where JOBS would be created, It didn't work. Obama agreed to an extension of the BUSH tax cuts while the GOP/Teabag Association held virtual gun to his head.. The Tax cuts Created nothing but more wealth for the Corporate buddies of Politicians.. Bachman is a whacked out teabagger who has no clue , even worse than Sara Palin, which I didn't think Possible. So of course the Blacks and Hispanics will again vote for Obama, as will a large percentage of the White community.
snakespit

Obama has failed America, just like Bush did, and like McCain probably would have, and like whoever takes over in 2012 or 2016 probably will. I saw Bachmann's speech at the RLC, and it was a joke. Bachmann is a typical politician in that she can talk four hours while actually saying very little. I noted that she offered no plausible solutions where Obama has failed...only criticism of his inability to do the job. The mark of a true leader is someone who can not only identify problems, but can offer and put into action sound solutions to said problems. 
 
 As of now, I will vote for Ron Paul...and when he drops out, I will not vote.
Symbiote

It is not the Governments Duty to Create Jobs. 

 
 
Invest in bringing America to current levels of technology while creating jobs

 
 
we need to SPEND more on infrastructure to get the Nation back to creating jobs.

 
 
The Targeted Cuts proposed by the GOP will... create more unemployment..

 
 
 The only consistency I see in your worldview is that you tow whatever line minimises negative associated with the democrats and plays them up when it comes to republicans.
 
 When republicans propose spending cuts, you oppose them because they will cost jobs, and the government should be investing, to create jobs. When Obama fails to improve employment rates, that's ok, since the government shouldn't be trying to create jobs anyway..
 
 It wouldn't hurt to have an honest discussion instead of some partisan talking point and a rant about "teabaggers"
Steeeeve

Xcaliber

Originally Posted by Xcaliber View Post
 It is not the Governments Duty to Create Jobs.Quote:
 
 Well it's not. Like I said above the Government Creates an Environment for Businesses to Create Jobs. But actually creating Jobs is not the Governments responsibility. 
 
 Originally Posted by Xcaliber 2 months ago View Post
 Invest in bringing America to current levels of technology while creating jobs
 Quote:
 
 By this I meant that by investing in New technology businesses would create new jobs to upgrade the existing technology. The Governments only role would be to invest to create a Job creating Environment.
 
 Originally Posted by Xcaliber 2 months ago View Post
 we need to SPEND more on infrastructure to get the Nation back to creating jobs.Quote:
 
 Same as above.. Again the Government is not ACTUALLY creating Jobs.
 
 Originally Posted by Xcaliber 4 months ago View Post
 The Targeted Cuts proposed by the GOP will... create more unemployment..
 
 Well this is true. The Government doesn't create jobs but by initiating bad economic policies they can cause businesses to lay off, go out of business, thus creating higher unemployment. 
 
 
The only consistency I see in your worldview is that you tow whatever line minimises negative associated with the democrats and plays them up when it comes to republicans.

 
 Exactly how is anything you quoted above minimalistic concerning my association with the Democratic party. Every quote with the exception of the last one was about the Government creating a stable economic environment where Jobs will be created in the Private sector. 
 
 

 When republicans propose spending cuts, you oppose them because they will cost jobs, and the government should be investing, to create jobs. When Obama fails to improve employment rates, that's ok, since the government shouldn't be trying to create jobs anyway..

 
 Again, you should really stop taking what I say and adding your own meaning to it. And I never said Obamas failure to create such an environment was ok,
 
 

 It wouldn't hurt to have an honest discussion instead of some partisan talking point and a rant about "teabaggers"

 
 No it wouldn't, but then again it's not so easy to have a " honest" discussion when politics are concerned.
Steeeeve

I think it's more that you simply don't understand what I said. It's not the Governments duty to create jobs. Creating jobs, and creating an environment where jobs will be created are two different things. 
 The Government SHOULD BE investing, To create an environment so that Jobs can be created. The Government can't hire you to go to work for General Electric, General Electric has to create a job and hire you themselves, and this is what is not happening.
Your statements are inconsistent and the only common theme is your hatred for the GOP. Are we really to believe that given two similar statements you choose to address them in completely different ways to show two different points or is the more obvious answer that you are being a hypocrite partisan the likely one? You know, sometimes the obvious answer is the right one. If you want to be taken seriously just own up when you're called out on a blatant hypocritical statement and move on. Everyone here has done it at some point.
Xcaliber

Your statements are inconsistent and the only common theme is your hatred for the GOP. You know, sometimes the obvious answer is the right one. If you want to be taken seriously just own up when you're called out on a blatant hypocritical statement and move on. Everyone here has done it at some point.

 
 I'm not being hypocritical . I've not hidden the fact that I do not like the GOP/Teabag association. I don't call myself a Democrat because I don't always agree with them either. How is that being hypocritical?. I've made no secret of the fact that I lean further left than right, more liberal than conservative. How is that being hypocritical?... The Statement in question was taken out of context or misunderstood, that doesn't make me a hypocrite.
Steeeeve

The Statement in question was taken out of context or misunderstood, that doesn't make me a hypocrite.
You blatantly apply two different standards based upon which party would end up looking bad. That makes you a hypocrite.
Xcaliber

You blatantly apply two different standards based upon which party would end up looking bad. That makes you a hypocrite.

 
 I didn't apply two standards.. I applied the same standard for both parties. I can't help if one party comes out looking worse than the other, the fact remains that it is not the Governments duty to create jobs..And by Government I mean both parties. I never said or implied otherwise.. Like I said, actually read it before making accusations.
